  • Constructor Details

      public CustomerQuery()

  • Method Details

    • customerInsert

      public static void customerInsert(String customerName, String customerAddress, String customerPostal, String customerPhone, String createDate, String createdBy, String lastUpdate, String lastUpdatedBy, int divisionID) throws SQLException
      Accept parameters and uses them to perform a query and INSERT info as a new record into the customers table.
      Parameters:
      customerName - name of customer
      customerAddress - address of customer
      customerPostal - postal code of customer
      customerPhone - phone number of customer
      createDate - date the customer record is made
      createdBy - who made the customer record
      lastUpdate - the last updated datetime of the record, which here will be the same as createDate
      lastUpdatedBy - who last updated the record, which here will be the same as createdBy
      divisionID - int that corresponds to the State/Province name as defined by the DB
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • customerUpdate

      public static void customerUpdate(String customerName, String customerAddress, String customerPostal, String customerPhone, String lastUpdate, String lastUpdatedBy, int divisionID, int customerID) throws SQLException
      Performs a query to update a customer record based on the selection in the tableview.
      Parameters:
      customerName - name of customer
      customerAddress - address of customer
      customerPostal - postal code of customer
      customerPhone - phone number of customer
      lastUpdate - the last updated datetime of the record
      lastUpdatedBy - who last updated the record
      divisionID - int that corresponds to the State/Province name as defined by the DB
      customerID - int ID of the customer, auto-generated by the DB and received from a String array of the selected item in the tableview.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • customerDelete

      public static void customerDelete(int customerID) throws SQLException
      Performs a query to delete a record based on the unique customer ID. Due to Foreign Key restraints, it first deletes all Appointments with the customerID parameter.
      Parameters:
      customerID - Unique customer ID auto-generated from the DB
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • customerDeleteAppointment

      public static void customerDeleteAppointment(int customerID) throws SQLException
      Uses the customerID to query the DB and delete all appointments with that customer ID.
      Parameters:
      customerID - Unique customer ID auto-generated from the DB, obtained at the same time as the customerDelete function.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • select

      public static ResultSet select() throws SQLException
      Queries for ALL info from the customers table.
      Returns:
      returns a result set of the query.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • selectDivisionID

      public static int selectDivisionID(String state) throws SQLException
      Returns the state ID number from the DB. Defaults to -1 as the value if the name is not found.
      Parameters:
      state - state name provided for the query.
      Returns:
      returns and integer corresponding to the State parameter, based on the DB.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • selectDivision

      public static String selectDivision(int division_id) throws SQLException
      Allows the program to retrieve a state name based on the input ID.
      Parameters:
      division_id - ID that should correspond to a state name.
      Returns:
      Returns the state name as a String based on the division ID.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • selectCountry

      public static String selectCountry(String state) throws SQLException
      Gets the Country name based on the state parameter by querying a JOIN of the countries and first-level-divisions tables.
      Parameters:
      state - name of a state
      Returns:
      Returns the name of the Country that the state parameter matches with.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • loadScreen

      public void loadScreen(String screenName) throws IOException
      Loads the scene based on screenName parameter and then closes the original stage window.
      Parameters:
      screenName - name of the FXML file to load
      Throws:
      IOException

    • logoutClick

      public void logoutClick() throws IOException
      Logs the user out of the program by loading the login_screen. Sets the loggedUser variable in login_screen to null.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • homeClick

      public void homeClick() throws IOException
      Loads the home page by passing the FXML filename to loadScreen.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • appointmentsClick

      public void appointmentsClick() throws IOException
      Loads the appointments page by passing the FXML filename to loadScreen.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • customerAddClick

      public void customerAddClick() throws IOException
      Loads the customer-add page by passing the FXML filename to loadScreen.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • customerModifyClick

      public void customerModifyClick()
      Takes the selected row of the tableview and loads that data using the initCustomerData method (in modify Customer) Loads the customer modify scene.

    • customerDeleteClick

      public void customerDeleteClick()
      Retrieves the customer ID of the selected row and using it in a query to delete the records of the customer of that ID.

    • getData

      public void getData()
      Gets data for all customers. Dynamically creates the columns and fills them for customers, based on the Result Set queried. Receives the data and then puts it into the observable list, then setting the Tableview with that list.

    • refreshTable

      public void refreshTable()
      Executes the getData function to reload the table. This function is mainly called with the FXML refresh-button.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Calls the getData method when the customer screen is loaded. Translates all labels and text to French when applicable.
